title: How to solve the ranking system
body:
At the moment the ranking system only takes into consideration the amount of games that you win/lose to give you an LP score. That means your personal score actually is based on not only how you played but also how the rest of the people on your team played. This actually makes sensed for those people who play 5:5 ranked games, those who choose their team to be how it is.

Now, for those in solo queue this doesn't really makes sense. Yes, wining a game does mean that yo are probably good, but you could also being carried the heeeeck out of it. At the same time, losing a game could have been because the other people was having a bad day, or there was one or 2 feeders/trolls on your team. 

Now, what if you were actually ranked by how YOU performed in the game based on Kills, Deaths, Assist, skills landed, etc? That would actually give a more accurate rank of the player itself rather than how a game ended up. Let's be honest, if you put Faker on a team with a few feeders/trolls and you make them play against an all Diamond team, chances are, Faker's team will lose even tho he would have done really well.

So, Riot, People... what can be done about this?

replies.body:
This is a terrible idea, always has been always will be.

It promotes a "Just play for me" style, your team means nothing, and your better off just chasing down that kill instead of getting that tower.

The whole ranking system is just shit. Especially for soloQ. Even if you play your heart out and get an absolutely useless team you still cop the full loss. It's magnified in lower elo's with all the intent feeding scrubs and afk trolls who fill the player base.

Ranking system fails in lower elos's, it's hardly ever a close game when the two teams are supposedly matched according to player skills. 90% of the time it's either you stomp or get stomped and few games fall in the middle where it's enjoyable. That's IF you don't get a troll or some unranked newbie on your team doing placements who clearly belongs in a lower elo than everyone on the team.
